title: Thank you!
comment: This is awesome. Was pretty frustrated with Google  including cricket in Google now sports. But this is better. I can see the score in my lock screen.

title: Great App
comment: One missing feature I would like to see would be being able to link to an ongoing series, instead of having to change and link for every individual match.
Javed, you can select a country in the preferences and it would automatically show the matches being played by that country.

title: Works well
comment: App works as described but will give 5 stars when option to open cricinfo app instead of webpage.

title: The Ashes
comment: 2nd Ashes test has just begun, I can see this extension is doing a great job keeping me up to date with the latest scores. Love it!

title: Good
comment: Nice little extension but would be good to have the option of opening cricinfo app or any other app instead of mobile site

title: One improvement for 5 stars
comment: When I click on the score I want it to launch my CricBuzz app instead of the cricinfo website. If this could allow me to launch a custom app or bookmark I'd give it 5 stars.

comment: This app is a must have for any cricket fan.

title: Great work

title: Convenient
comment: It looks great.   On issue though, one has to manually select a match to view the scores. Can it not be automatically selected?  EDIT: The feature -has been added.  Thumbs up..
Hi Jisan, not sure whether you have upgraded to the latest version (1.2), but it now has an ability to select a country and have the scores shown automatically whenever that country plays.

title: Does exactly what it says on the tin
comment: Now you can add a country, it only shows you scores from that country.   Perfect.

title: Almost perfect
comment: Tapping on the score should ideally take you to mobile site of Cric info.
The latest version now defaults to the mobile site.

title: Promising start
comment: Great little extension, however would love the option to be able to turn off the game without getting rid of the extension completely.   Also might be a long shot, but would also be good to have an option that allows you to only see the extension when the game is actually live (ie hide scores overnight)  Thanks

Hi Josh, not sure if you upgraded to the latest version (1.2), but it now has an option to turn off the scores. Turning off the scores overnight might need a little bit more intelligence in the app. Will take a look.

title: Nice start!
comment: Could do with one more level of customisation. Maybe choosing multiple matches? Also, the click through ideally should be to the mobile site. But this is a great start!
The latest version now defaults to the mobile site.

title: Nicely done!
comment: Simple. Clean. Works.

title: Needs improvement
comment: I'm still about to view the scores. I'll have to wait for a match to start.
